availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Pierce (Princeton, Kentucky, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Princeton, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Kentucky native. Married to Betty Pierce. Father of Frank Pierce, Florence Pierce, Willie Pierce. farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned twenty-four enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860. Member of convention of the provisional government at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 301A.
